name: Al Capone's Grave
description: "Buried in a family plot at Mt. Caramel Cemetery in Hillside, Illinois, lies one of America's most infamous gangsters, Al Capone."

name: Resurrection Mary Cemetery
description: A phantom hitchhiker said to vanish near Resurrection Cemetery, often spotted along Archer Avenue late at night.

name: Bachelor's Grove Cemetery
description: An abandoned cemetery known for apparitions, floating lights, and ghostly figures captured in photographs.

name: St. James at Sag Bridge
description: A historic church rumored to be a portal to hell, with strange lights and unexplained sounds reported by visitors.

name: The Bell Witch Cave
description: Home to one of America's most famous hauntings, involving poltergeist activity and eerie voices.

name: The Myrtles Plantation
description: A former plantation said to be haunted by the spirits of enslaved people and a woman named Chloe.

name: Eastern State Penitentiary
description: A former prison known for violent history and reported shadow figures, echoes, and cell door sounds.

name: The Stanley Hotel
description: The inspiration for Stephen King's The Shining, with reports of music, laughter, and apparitions.

name: Winchester Mystery House
description: A sprawling mansion built continuously to appease spirits, filled with staircases to nowhere.

name: Jerome Grand Hotel
description: Once a hospital, now a hotel where guests report ghostly nurses and phantom footsteps.

name: Trans-Allegheny Lunatic Asylum
description: A massive abandoned asylum known for reported screams, shadow people, and lingering energy.

name: The Goatman's Bridge
description: A bridge said to be haunted by a half-man, half-goat entity that appears after dark.

name: Sloss Furnaces
description: An abandoned ironworks with reports of ghostly workers and unexplained accidents.

name: The Queen Mary
description: A retired ocean liner rumored to house spirits of former passengers and crew.

name: Bellamy Bridge
description: An old bridge where a bride is said to search endlessly for her lost groom.

name: The Lizzie Borden House
description: The site of infamous axe murders, now a bed and breakfast with paranormal reports.

name: Hoia Baciu Forest
description: A forest known for UFO sightings, electronic malfunctions, and disappearances.

name: The Whaley House
description: A historic home with sightings of former residents and unexplained noises.

name: Devil's Tramping Ground
description: A barren circle where nothing grows, said to be where the devil walks at night.

name: The Sallie House
description: A house associated with violent paranormal activity believed to involve a spirit named Sallie.

name: LaLaurie Mansion
description: A historic mansion infamous for cruelty and ghost sightings tied to its dark past.

name: Gettysburg Battlefield
description: The site of one of the bloodiest battles of the Civil War, known for apparitions of soldiers and phantom gunfire.

name: Waverly Hills Sanatorium
description: A former tuberculosis hospital infamous for shadow figures, voices, and unexplained phenomena.

name: The Villisca Axe Murder House
description: A small home where a brutal unsolved axe murder occurred, now associated with disturbing paranormal activity.

name: Marfa Lights
description: Unexplained glowing orbs that appear in the desert, baffling observers for generations.

name: Point Pleasant TNT Area
description: An abandoned military site tied to sightings of the Mothman and other strange occurrences.

name: The Devil's Tower
description: A massive rock formation surrounded by legends of supernatural forces and strange energies.

name: The Amityville House
description: A suburban home linked to infamous murders and alleged demonic hauntings.

name: The Crescent Hotel
description: A historic hotel said to house spirits from its time as a hospital and resort.

name: Salem Witch House
description: A surviving structure connected to the Salem witch trials and lingering supernatural lore.

name: The Old Charleston Jail
description: A former jail where inmates reportedly left behind restless spirits and eerie sounds.

name: Pine Barrens
description: A vast forest known for legends of the Jersey Devil and unexplained disappearances.

name: The Stanley R. Mickelsen Safeguard Complex
description: An abandoned Cold War missile defense site with reports of strange noises and sightings.

name: The Lemp Mansion
description: A historic mansion associated with tragic deaths and recurring ghost sightings.

name: The Devil's Kettle
description: A waterfall where objects disappear mysteriously, fueling local legends.

name: The Sorrel-Weed House
description: A historic home rumored to be haunted by former residents and unexplained footsteps.

name: The Riddle House
description: A former funeral home associated with shadow figures and paranormal disturbances.

name: The Overtoun Bridge
description: A bridge infamous for unexplained animal behavior and tragic legends.

name: The Enchanted Forest
description: A remote area known for strange lights, disorientation, and missing time reports.

name: The Brown Lady of Raynham Hall
description: A ghostly figure said to roam a historic estate, often captured in photographs.

name: The Devil's Backbone
description: A stretch of land where travelers report disembodied voices and ghostly lights.

name: The Palmer House Hotel
description: A grand hotel with a long history of reported apparitions and unexplained sounds.

name: The Bell Witch Farm
description: Land associated with the infamous Bell Witch haunting and lingering paranormal claims.

name: The Old Alton Bridge
description: A bridge known locally as Goatman's Bridge, tied to violent legends and sightings.

name: The Devil's Chair
description: A stone chair said to be cursed, bringing misfortune to those who sit in it.

name: The Moonville Tunnel
description: An abandoned railroad tunnel associated with ghostly lantern lights and apparitions.
